org.opensocial.auth
Class OAuth3LeggedScheme

java.lang.Object
  org.opensocial.auth.OAuth3LeggedScheme
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, AuthScheme
public class OAuth3LeggedScheme
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuthScheme, java.io.Serializable

Authentication class that exposes methods for retrieving request and access tokens and an appropriate authorization URL for the 3-Legged OAuth "dance." For reference: http://sites.google.com/site/oauthgoog/2leggedoauth/2opensocialrestapi

Author:
Christoph Renner, Jason Cooper
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

OAuth3LeggedScheme

protected OAuth3LeggedScheme()

OAuth3LeggedScheme

public OAuth3LeggedScheme(Provider provider,
                          java.lang.String consumerKey,
                          java.lang.String consumerSecret)
Creates and returns a new OAuth3LeggedScheme configured with the passed Provider, key, and secret.

Parameters:
provider - OpenSocial provider that the current user should be authenticated against; must have the three required 3-legged OAuth endpoints set (see GoogleProvider and MySpaceProvider for reference)
consumerKey - key provided by an OpenSocial container after registering a new application
consumerSecret - secret provided by an OpenSocial container after registering a new application

getAuthorizationUrl

public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(java.lang.String callbackUrl)
                                     throws net.oauth.OAuthException,
                                            java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                            java.io.IOException
Sends a signed request to the associated provider to retrieve an initial request token. If successful, returns a URL to the associated provider's authorization page; after being forwarded to this URL, the user will be prompted to enter their account credentials and upon successful sign-in, will be forwarded again to the specified callback URL.

Parameters:
callbackUrl - URL to forward user to after successful sign-in
Returns:
URL to provider's authorization page as a string
Throws:
net.oauth.OAuthException
java.net.URISyntaxException
java.io.IOException

requestAccessToken

public void requestAccessToken(java.lang.String oAuthToken)
                        throws net.oauth.OAuthException,
                               java.net.URISyntaxException,
                               java.io.IOException
Sends a signed request to the associated provider to exchange the passed request token for an access token; if successfully exchanged, this token can then be accessed using getAccessToken().

Parameters:
oAuthToken - previously fetched request token to exchange for access token
Throws:
net.oauth.OAuthException
java.net.URISyntaxException
java.io.IOException

requestAccessToken

public void requestAccessToken(java.lang.String oAuthToken,
                               java.lang.String oAuthVerifier)
                        throws net.oauth.OAuthException,
                               java.net.URISyntaxException,
                               java.io.IOException
Sends a signed request to the associated provider to exchange the passed request token for an access token; if successfully exchanged, this token can then be accessed using getAccessToken().

Parameters:
oAuthToken - previously fetched request token to exchange for access token
oAuthVerifier - verification code returned by some providers, e.g. Yahoo
Throws:
net.oauth.OAuthException
java.net.URISyntaxException
java.io.IOException

getProvider

public Provider getProvider()
Returns the associated provider.

getRequestToken

public OAuth3LeggedScheme.Token getRequestToken()
Returns the request token previously retrieved from the provider when getAuthorizationUrl was executed or null if no request token is associated with the current instance.

See Also:
getAuthorizationUrl(String)

getAccessToken

public OAuth3LeggedScheme.Token getAccessToken()
Returns the access token for which the original request token was exchanged or null if the exchange hasn't occurred and no access token is associated with the current instance.

See Also:
requestAccessToken(String)

setRequestToken

public void setRequestToken(OAuth3LeggedScheme.Token token)
Associates the specified request token with the current instance.

Parameters:
token - request token to associate
